html:
Google Maps makes it easy to find the best routes, and one of its most useful tools is the ability to set departure and arrival times directly in the mobile app. While this feature was initially exclusive to the desktop site, it’s now fully integrated into the app for both iPhone and Android. This allows you to plan ahead and get accurate travel estimates based on predicted traffic conditions.

To use this feature, ensure your Google Maps app is updated. Once updated, you can choose departure and/or arrival times to plan your trip efficiently. This is perfect for ensuring you leave at the right time and arrive exactly when needed.

  • Get the latest version of Google Maps: Android | iOS

Setting Departure or Arrival Times

With Google Maps, scheduling a trip based on when you'd like to leave for or arrive at a desired location couldn't be easier. Simply input your destination as you normally would in the “Search here” field at the top of the screen. Then, tap "Directions" on the location card to see available routes.

Afterward, choose the best route from the selections given. From there, tap on the three dots in the top right next to the starting point and hit "Set depart or arrive time” from the list of options.

Now, choose “Leave” and set your anticipated departure date and time or “Arrive” and set the time and date you’d like to reach your destination. When ready, hit "Set" (Android) or “Done” (iOS).

Google Maps will display the average travel time for the route and your selected departure or arrival time. If you need to make changes or switch between “Leave” and “Arrive,” you can tap the time to adjust it.

On iOS, you can expand the route card and scroll to the bottom to find a “Remind you to leave on time” toggle. Turn it on, and it will choose the best time to notify you and show it to you so you know when to expect a notification. That way, you’ll be less likely to get off schedule. On Android, this feature is missing.
